isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING SLEEPER LIGHTING AND ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - Refrigerator Wiring W/PRO SLEEPER

svcproc.title: Refrigerator Wiring W/PRO SLEEPER
svcproc.para: With the Refrigerator ON/OFF Switch in the position, power flows from battery stud B2 through circuit 14AK, 14AV, fuse F10 - B, circuit 14AX, fuse 582 - C, circuit 86AV, Refrigerator ON/OFF Switch, circuit 86AG to the Refrigerator Power Source. The ground path is circuit 86 - GR, 11 - GBD, and 11 - GBE to ground adapter (454). When the ignition is turned ON, power energizes the Auxiliary Bunk Blower Relay which makes available power to circuits 75X and 62X going to Refrigerator ON/OFF Switch. This illuminates the panel lamp LED through ground path 62 - GX, 86 - GK, 11 - GAF, 11 - GBC, 11 - GBD, and 11 - GBE to ground adapter (454). When the Refrigerator ON/OFF switch is turned ON, the indicator LED will illuminate through ground path 62 - GX, 86 - GK, 11 - GAF, 11 - GBC, 11 - GBD, and 11 - GBE to ground adapter (454).
